answers.answer: Mountain Dew has high amounts of caffeine. Suggest she go to a MD and get checked.

question: So my fiancée told me that when she drinks mountain dew or sips alcohol she has tingling in her fingers.I know insulin causes vasodilation, I know caffeine can cause vasoconstriction and I know that long term alcoholics suffer with tingling in the extremities. I also know that a sign that diabetes is close is tingling in the extremities due to insulin resistance.So I am confused now
title: Tingling Fingers with consumption of drinks
